commentBody:
The Warriors were considered a great team, but with the signing of Kevin Durant they have become formidable. The Spurs with the signing of Pau Gasol are now a great team. The Celtics, by signing Al Horford, solved a weakness and may be a great team.

The Knicks got Derrick Rose and if he is healthy and is joined by Russell Westbrook, the Knicks could be great. The Grizzlies, by retaining Mike Conley and signing Chandler Parsons to join a healthy Marc Gasol and Zach Randolph, became a great team.

The list goes on of teams spending big bucks to make big improvements.

The reigning NBA champions, Cavaliers, on the other hand, lost one starter to free agency and then decided to use the odd strategy of standing pat. The Cavs do have a high luxury tax, but their new austerity may make is difficult for them even to make the playoffs next season.

Apparently, one championship is all the franchise wants during the Lebron Era
